Is not the ſure propheticall Word, Qu. 86. a light that ſhines in a dark corner, till the true day light ariſe, in your hearts? 2 Pet. 1.19.

But it is the light of Chriſt, that leads unto Chriſt the perfect day?Anſ. which light ſhines in darkneſſe, and darkneſſe comprehends it not, and therefore thou looks without, Iohn 1.5. for another light before the light of Chriſt.
Whether the life of Chriſt be not the true light that men are to waite for, Qu. 8 1. and wherein the true Children of light are to walk? and thou quoteſt, Iohn 1.4. and Eph. 5, 9.

Thou haſt here anſwered thy ſelfe,Anſ. for his life is the
light of men, which they muſt waite to know within them, to guide them: and thou that would'ſt ſet up another light, before this light, art a deceiver; and this is the light which now is come into the world, teſtifying againſt the world, Iohn. 3.19.20. and manifeſting you to be the de ••• ers of the world, who have long ſet up falſe lights to draw from this true light, the minds of people: therefore now you can no longer hide your ſelves from this true light, you ſtand up to oppoſe it where it is ſet up, and ſome calls it a naturall light, and an inſufficient light, but it is your condemnation.

div.head: Thy next is concerning Prophets and Propheteſſes
div.p: Whether ſome men may not be acted with a Spirit of falſehood, Que. 82. and deluſion, even then when they think they Propheſie by the Spirit of God as Zedekiah was, 1 King 22.
This is already anſwered in my reply to thy anſwer to any 6th. Query:Anſ. and thou in divers places to be thus acted.

Whether the Lord did ever ſend forth boyes or ſtriplings to be his prophets & publike teachers, Q. 83. ſeeing John the Baptiſt who was born to be a Prophet, of the moſt high, and was filled with the Holy-Ghoſt from his Mothers wombe, was not ſent forth to preach and Propheſie till he was 30 yeares old Luk. 1.15.

How often have I made thy folly and ignorance,Anſ. in this to appeare? and that thou might be aſhamed to boaſt of thy age, who ſo often haſt erred not knowing the Scriptures nor the power of God, who would limit it to time & age, in which I have before ſufficiently anſwered thee and now I ſay the Lord ſent forth Ieremiah when he was but a Child, Ier. 1.6.7. Pſal. 8.2. Mat. 21. and out of the mouths of Babes and Sucklings, the Lord hath perfected his praiſe, therefore hence-forward ſtop thy mouth, for deſpiſing any bebecauſe of their youth, but know this that whomſoever
God calls to his Miniſtry, he by his power and wiſdom doth fit them, for the ſame, and contrary to the reaſon of man, doth the Lord work, therefore if thou waſt not blind, thou would'ſt not ſo much looke at the creature, Math. 11.25. but at the power of God in the creature: but as it is written, He hath hid theſe things from the wiſe and prudent, and revealed them unto Babes: and here thy 84. Querie, is alſo anſwered.
Whether the Lord will breake his own orders and commands, Qu. 85 expreſſely ſet down in his word, where he ſaith (as you already heard) by Paul 1 Tim. 3.6.

And unto this I have already anſwered,Anſw. at to thy 37, Querie: therefore thou blaſphemer, ſtop thy mouth and be aſhamed thus to accuſe the Lord, becauſe he is pleaſed to make his power known, in babes and youth, for Timothy, to whom Paul writes this Epiſtle was himſelfe but a youth, as Paul writes 1 Tim. 4.11.12. and there read thy rebuke,
Where did Chriſt or his Apoſtles ſend forth women to be publique propheteſſes as you have don many and ſome of them not long ſince infamous for lewdneſſe of life. Qu. 86.

Oh thou impudent one,Anſw. how doſt thou provoke the Lord to indignation againſt thee, that darſt lay any ſuch thing to the Charge of Gods elect? oh thou lier, whom doſt thou accuſe of lewdneſſe? we abhor thy words for all lewdneſſe, and prophaneſſe we teſtify againſt, whereſoever it doth appeare, or any thing contrary to the pure divine light, which now in thy conſcience, and many other conſciences doth here witneſſe, for us, againſt thee who art given up to beleivelies, and report them: therefore read thy portion in Rev. 21.8. and read an anſwer to thy Querie, in Joel. 2.28. where the Lord ſaith the ſons and Daughters ſhall propheſy, Rom. 16.1.2.3.4. and none other do we own but who immediately are caried forth by the Spirit of the Lord, without the commiſſion of man: therefore thou falſly accuſeſt us, who ſaiſt we ſend forth any.
If you be extraordinary Prophets immediatly inſpired as many of you pretend to be, Qu. 87. where are the miracles which ſuch inſpired men wrought in times paſt?

But that we are ſo inſpired thou doſt not beleive,Anſ. (as may eaſily be diſcerned by thy Querying) and therefore unto thee no ſigne ſhall be given who art in the adulterous generation who cannot ſee the ſignes that follow the truth, Math. 16.4.
What have you foretold by way of praediction, Qu. 88. which hath accordingly come to paſſe as the Prophets, Apoſtles and inſpired men were wont to do?
If thou canſt tax us to the contrary thou maiſt,Anſw. we beare not witneſſe of our ſelves, but he that beleives hath the witneſſe within himſelf.
And as for thy 89.90.91. and 92. Queries, they are anſwered in my reply to thy anſwer to my 16. Querie, and thy 93. Querie, is anſwered in my anſwer to thy Query concerning Salutations.

Whether is a multitude of diſciples and followers, Que. 94. ſure figne that his doctrine is from heaven, who is followed, ſeeing the way is broad that leads to deſtruction and many there be that find it, and thou quoteſt, Math. 7.13. and 2, Pet. 2.22.

Many are called but few chofen,Anſw. and many for a time followed Chriſt, ſo that the ruler ſaid if we let this fellow alone, all men will goe after him, which is the cry of you and your rulers, now againſt the meſſengers of truth, and haſt thou never read of the multitudes that followed Chriſt, but few there be that enter, Iohn 11.48. Mat. 7.14. becauſe ſtrate is the Gate; but devide England into parts, and ſee if the greateſt number belong not unto you, who are in the broad way: your lives preach you forth, therefore now thou ſhould have firſt asked thy ſelf this Query, and ſaid Is it I, and ſo have laid thy hand upon thy mouth.

Seeing this age is earthly-minded and willing to ſerve God, Qu. 95. with that which coſts them nothing contrary to the pious and noble ſpirit of David 2 Sam. 24.24. is it any great wonder that your doctrine againſt Tithes, ſhould find ſo many willing yea greedy entertayners of it, as it hath done ſince it was firſt broached?

The more is your ſhame, who are teachers in this age, that are ſo earthly-minded,Anſw. who have ſo long taken their monies for that which is not bread, and their labour for that which profiteth not: Iſa. 55.2. do you not herein manifeſt your ſelves to be ſuch as run, and the Lord never ſent you, Ier. 23.21.22.32. and therefore you profit not the people at all, but they are ſtill earthly-minded, how have you then ſowne ſpirituall things? but I ſhall prove that the earthly-minded ones ſtill ſtick unto you, for you have a law made by the will of man, ſo that if they refuſe to pay you, and forſake you, then by it you caſt them into priſon, and by your law take treble damage, and this they know, and therefore conſult with their earthly mindes, that it is better to pay the leſſer then the greater,there is much difference betwixt ſervings God and your bellies. though the leſſer is a greater oppreſſion: and thus mank deny the truth, though they are convinced in their conſciences thereof, therefore that which leads any from you, to take up this croſſe to own the truth, and deny you of Tithes, the ſame crucifies the earthly mind, and leade to ſuffer for conſcience. And the noble Spirit of David condemnes you: for whereas he refuſed upon gift, you will take upon gift, and if they will not give it you, you will take it by force, therefore this Scripture affords witneſſes againſt you, but hereby thou confeſſeſt, our doctrine coſts them nothing; then how ſaid'ſt thou before that James Parnels Goſpel was not without charge, and thus out of thy own mouth art thou proved a liar.
Did ever Chriſt or the Apoſtles diſturb the Prieſts, and Miniſters of theſe times, Qu. 96. while they were teaching the people, as many of you and yours have done?

Both the Prophets, Chriſt and the Apoſtles,Anſw. declared againſt the deceivers, falſe Prophets, Mat. 24.24. Ier. 23. Ezek. 34. Ioh. 10. Ier. 5.31. falſe Prieſts and Hirelings, and the Apoſtles was haled out of the Synagogues, and out of the Temple, as Chriſt told them John 16.2. as we by the ſame ſpirit do now againſt you, whom we finde in the ſame ſteps, and here thou art anſwered, if this be it thou calleſt diſturbance; but it is becauſe you would bear rule by your means, and ſuffer nothing to be publiſhed, that is againſt you, or ſtrikes at your Diana.
Doth the Goſpel ordinarily call any man from his lawful Calling, Qu: 97. whereby he ſhould maintain himſelf and his Family? and thou quoteſt 1 Cor. 7, 20. Eph. 4.28.

Yea it doth, and the Scripture holds forth the ſame that they was ordinarily called from their outward Callings,Anſw. to preach the Goſpel to every Creature: Amos. 7.14.15. Mark. 16.15. Math. 4.18.19.20.21.22.23. neither doth either of theſe Scriptures which thou haſt quoted prove to the contrary; & how many Scriptures didſt thou quote in thy Anſwer to my 15th Query to prove that the Miniſters of the Goſpel might forbear working, and not to entangle themſelves with the affairs of this life: yet in all could not prove thy ſelfe a Miniſter of the Goſpel, and now thou queſtions the truth of the Scripture, becauſe neither thou nor thy Brethren was called, according to Scripture; but whomſoever the Lord calls unto his work, he doth take care both for him and his Family; but you that are not called by him, dare not truſt him, without a Law of man.

And in thy 98. & 99. Query,2. Theſ. 3. Mat.
• 8.7. thou ſeems to accuſe us with ſome that turned from the truth, and yielded to the deceipt of their heares, and ſo gave occaſion to ſuch as
thee, who wait for occaſion to blaſpheme the truth; but it is no new thing,1 Tim. 14.15. but the ſame which the Scripture declares of in divers places: therefore ſaith Chriſt, offences muſt come, but woe unto them by whom they do come; Mat. 26 Mat. 27.5. for there was then many ſuch as thee in that age who (as thou doſt) waited for occaſion to blaſpheme the truth; but if thou hadſt been then, how would'ſt thou have accuſed Chriſt, who had but twelve Apoſtles, and one of them betrayed him, and then hanged himſelfe, and another denied him: therefore let this ſtop thy mouth, for ſpeaking evil of the things thou knoweſt not; and as for Spencer and Gilpin, whom thou here nominates, the truth is ſufficiently cleared of them in other Books; and the Prieſts have owned them, as they did Judas, which is the name of all that turn from the truth, after they have received it.
Have ſo many fallen into diſtraction or madneſs in any Sect, Qu: 100. or under any Doctrine, as there hath done amongſt your hearers, eſpecially where the number of Diſciples was no more?

Look at home, and anſwer thy ſelfe, witneſs your Univerſities,Anſ. as you call them; for it is the fruit of your ſtudies, who would finde out that by your wit and wiſdom, which the Lord hath hid from you; and all that you cannot ſettle in ſecurity and blindneſs, you lead them into madneſs, confuſion, and diſtraction, if they do not in time forſake you, as many will witneſs at this day that they are led by you into ſuch a Wilderneſſe, that they know not which way to get out, neither do you know how to direct them, for you are in confuſion your ſelves, Mat. 15 14. and ſo the blinde leads the blinde into the ditch: therefore this might have ſtopped thy mouth from falſly accuſing us; but I remember truth was ever accounted madneſs and folly by the blinde World, who know not
that Godlineſs is great gain. And in thy 94. Query, thou waſt queſtioning the truth of our Doctrine, becauſe of the multitude of Diſciples, and now by the fewneſs; and thus thou contradicts thy ſelfe, and then after much of thy filthy ſtuffe, which all along thou haſt vented forth of thy old bottle againſt us, which upon thee I have returned again from whence it came: thou ſeemeſt to accuſe our book, but doſt not ſhew wherein, and therefore I paſſe it by, as knowing thy lying ſpirit, and then thou ſtealeſt the Apoſtles words, for a Cloak for the deceipt of thy heart, 2 Cor. 13.7, 8, 9. which the Apoſtle ſpoke from a true and upright heart, but thou from a falſe deceiptful heart, as all along hath been ſufficiently proved, and thy prayers to be abomination, and that thou haſt nothing to do to name the name of God in thy mouth, who art a worker of iniquity, and a ſtranger unto God, who art found out of his Doctrine;2 Tim. 2, 19. 2 Ioh. 9. and therefore with this Scripture I ſhall mark thee, 2 John 9.10. that all may know thee, and turn away their eares from thee, who art not to be received, but denied; and therefore whoſoever receives thee, or thy Doctrine, the ſame departs from the Doctrine of Chriſt; and therefore let this be a Caveat to all people, to whom it ſhall come, and look upon thee to be as Anathema, Maranatha, 1 Cor. 16.22.

closer.signed: This from a friend, to all ſouls witneſſed in all conſciences by the eternall Light of God, by which I am known and received. I. P.
